Autoapagado después de un tiempo específico.

featureDescriptions.Controls the behaviour when the device i: Controla el comportamiento cuando el dispositivo se enciende

featureDescriptions.Decoupled mode for left button: Modo desacoplado para el botón izquierdo

featureDescriptions.Enables/disables window detection on the: Activa/desactiva detección de ventanas en el dispositivo
featureDescriptions.Enabling prevents both relais being on a: Activándolo evita que los dos relés estén activos al mismo tiempo
featureDescriptions.Indicates if CO (carbon monoxide) is det: Indica si se ha detectado CO (monóxido de carbono)
featureDescriptions.Indicates if the battery of this device: Indica si la batería de este dispositivo está casi vacía
featureDescriptions.Indicates if the contact is closed (= tr: Indica si el contacto está cerrado (= true) o abierto (= false)
featureDescriptions.Indicates whether the device detected a: Indica si el dispositivo ha detectado una fuga de agua
featureDescriptions.Indicates whether the device detected oc: Indica si el dispositivo ha detectado ocupación
featureDescriptions.Indicates whether the device detected sm: Indica si el dispositivo ha detectado humo
featureDescriptions.Indicates whether the device is tampered: Indica si el dispositivo está forzado
featureDescriptions.Link quality (signal strength): Calidad del enlace (fuerza de la señal)
featureDescriptions.Measured electrical potential value: Valor de la potencia electrica medida
featureDescriptions.Offset to be used in the local_temperatu: Diferencial parar usa con temperatura local
featureDescriptions.Recover state after power outage: Recupera el estado después de un corte de energía
featureDescriptions.Triggers an effect on the light (e.g. ma: Activa un efecto en la luz (p.ej. hacerla parpadear unos segundos)
featureDescriptions.Voltage of the battery in millivolts: Voltaje de la batería en milivoltios
featureDescriptions.Week format user for schedule: Formato de semana usado para programación
featureDescriptions.Boost Heating: press and hold \"+\" for: Calentamiento acelerado: mantenga presionado "+" durante 3 segundos, el dispositivo ingresará al modo de calentamiento acelerado y ▷╵◁ parpadeará. La cuenta atrás se mostrará en la aplicación.
featureDescriptions.Boost Time Setting 100 sec - 900 sec, (d: Ajuste de tiempo de impulso 100 segundos - 900 segundos, (por defecto = 300 segundos)
featureDescriptions.ECO mode (energy saving mode): Modo ECO (modo de ahorro de energía)
featureDescriptions.Indicates whether the device detected pr: Indica si el dispositivo ha detectado presencia
featureDescriptions.Indicates whether the device detected vi: Indica si el dispositivo ha detectado vibración
featureDescriptions.Schedule MODE ⏱ - In this mode, the devi: MODO DE programación - En este modo, el dispositivo ejecuta una semana preestablecida programando el tiempo y la temperatura.
featureDescriptions.Window status closed or open: Estado de ventana abierta o cerrada
featureDescriptions.Position of the valve (= demanded heat): Posición de la válvula (= calor demandado) donde 0% es totalmente cerrado and 100% es totalmente abierto
featureDescriptions.User ID to set or clear the pincode for: ID del usuario para poner o borrar el pincode para
featureDescriptions.Pincode to set, set pincode to null to c: El código PIN, poner null para deshabilitarlo
featureDescriptions.Click mode, fast: only supports single c: Modo de clic, rápido: solo admite un solo clic que se enviará inmediatamente después de hacer clic, múltiple: admite más eventos como doble click y mantener
Modo de click, rapido: solo admite un solo clic que se enviará inmediatamente después de hacer clic. multi: admite mas eventos como duplicar y mantener
featureDescriptions.Enable/disable the power outage memory,: Activa/desactiva la memoria para cortes de energía, esto recupera el modo encendido/apagado después de un corte de energía
featureDescriptions.Enable/disable the LED at night: Activar/desactivar el LED por la noche
featureDescriptions.Maximum allowed load, turns off if excee: Carga máxima permitida, se apaga si se excede
featureDescriptions.Control both relay and usb or only the r: Controle tanto el relé como el usb o solo el relé con el botón de interruptor físico
featureDescriptions.Time interval in seconds to report after: El intervalo en segundos a notificar después de que la luz cambie
featureDescriptions.Indicates whether a plug is physically a: Indica si un enchufe está conectado físicamente. El dispositivo no tiene que consumir energía o incluso estar conectado eléctricamente (el estado de este interruptor binario puede estar ENCENDIDO incluso si el interruptor de alimentación principal está APAGADO)
featureDescriptions.Anti flicker mode can be used to solve b: El modo antiparpadeo se puede usar para resolver problemas de parpadeo de algunas luces. El modo rápido hace que el dispositivo responda más rápido.
featureDescriptions.Operation mode, select \"command\" to en: Modo de operación, seleccione "comando" para habilitar los enlaces (¡despierte el dispositivo antes de cambiar de modo!)
featureDescriptions.LCD brightness (will not persist if auto: Brillo de la pantalla LCD (no persistirá si el brillo automático está habilitado)
featureDescriptions.Control which switches are available in: Controla qué interruptores están disponibles en la pantalla de interruptores (ninguno desactiva la pantalla de interruptores)
featureDescriptions.Indicates whether the device detected ga: Indica si el dispositivo ha detectado gas
featureDescriptions.If the power is constantly lower than 2W: Si la potencia es constantemente inferior a 2W en media hora, el enchufe se apagará automáticamente
featureDescriptions.Turn the device automatically off when a: Apaga el dispositivo automáticamente cuando el dispositivo conectado consume menos de 2W durante 20 minutos
featureDescriptions.Operation mode for left button: Modo de operación para el botón izquierdo
featureDescriptions.Operation mode for right button: Modo de operación para el botón derecho
featureDescriptions.Detected by sudden temperature drop or s: Detectado por la caída repentina de temperatura o ajuste manual.
featureDescriptions.Manually set window_open, ~1 minute to t: Asignar manualmente window_open, tomará sobre 1 minuto en funcionar
Número de transacción de la última acción.
featureDescriptions.Alarm zone. Default value 0: Zona de Alarma. Valor por defecto 0
featureDescriptions.Represents the time taken to move to or: Representa el tiempo que se tarda en desplazarse hacia o desde el nivel de destino cuando se reciben comandos de Encendido o Apagado por un clúster de Encendido/Apagado
featureDescriptions.Represents the time taken to move the cu: Representa el tiempo que tarda en pasar el nivel actual del nivel mínimo al máximo cuando se recibe una orden de encendido
Representa el tiempo que tarda en pasar el nivel actual del nivel máximo al nivel mínimo cuando se recibe una orden de apagado
featureDescriptions.Defines the desired startup level for a: Define el nivel de arranque deseado para un dispositivo cuando se le suministra energía
featureDescriptions.Specifies the minimum light output the b: Especifica la potencia luminosa mínima que puede alcanzar el balasto.
featureDescriptions.Specifies the maximum light output the b: Especifica la máxima potencia lumínica que puede alcanzar el balastro.
featureDescriptions.Specifies the minimum light output of th: Especifica la potencia lumínica mínima del balastro
featureDescriptions.Specifies the maximum light output of th: Especifica la potencia lumínica máxima del balastro
featureDescriptions.Specifies the minimum light output after: Especifica la salida mínima de luz tras el encendido
featureDescriptions.The dimmer supports AC forward phase con: El atenuador admite el control de la fase de avance de la CA.
featureDescriptions.The dimmer supports AC reverse phase con: El atenuador admite el control de fase inversa de CA.
featureDescriptions.The dimmer is capable of measuring the r: El regulador es capaz de medir la reactancia para distinguir las cargas inductivas y capacitivas.
featureDescriptions.The dimmer is capable of replacing the b: El regulador es capaz de sustituir la curva de regulación incorporada por defecto.
featureDescriptions.The dimmer is capable of detecting an ou: El regulador es capaz de detectar una sobrecarga en la salida y apagarla.
featureDescriptions.The dimmer is currently operating in AC: El atenuador está funcionando actualmente en el modo de control de fase de avance de CA.
El atenuador está funcionando actualmente en modo de control de fase inversa de CA.
featureDescriptions.The output is currently turned off, beca: La salida está actualmente apagada, porque el regulador ha detectado una sobrecarga.
featureDescriptions.The dimmer's reactance discriminator had: El discriminador de reactancia del atenuador había detectado una carga capacitiva.
El discriminador de reactancia del atenuador había detectado una carga inductiva.
featureDescriptions.Operation mode: \"command\" - for group: Modo de funcionamiento: "comando" - para el control de grupos, "evento" - para los clics
featureDescriptions.direction of movement from the point of: dirección del movimiento desde el punto de vista del radar
featureDescriptions.Device valve is open or closed (heating: La válvula del dispositivo está abierta o cerrada (calentando o no)
featureDescriptions.MANUAL MODE ☝ - In this mode, the device: MODO MANUAL ☝ - En este modo, el aparato ejecuta el ajuste manual de la temperatura. Cuando la temperatura ajustada es inferior a la "temperatura mínima", la válvula se cierra (cierre forzado). MODO AUTOMÁTICO ⏱ - En este modo, el aparato ejecuta una programación semanal de la temperatura tiempo y temperatura. ON - En este modo, el termostato permanece abierto OFF - En este modo, el termostato permanece cerrado
featureDescriptions.Auto MODE ⏱ - In this mode, the device e: MODO AUTOMÁTICO ⏱ - En este modo, el aparato ejecuta una semana preestablecida programando el tiempo y la temperatura
featureDescriptions.Setting minimum 0 - maximum 465 seconds: Ajuste mínimo 0 - máximo 465 segundos de tiempo de impulso. La función de impulso (♨) está activada. El tiempo restante se contará en segundos (465 a 0).
featureDescriptions.The holiday mode( ⛱ ) will automatically: El modo vacaciones ( ⛱ ) comenzará automáticamente a la hora establecida y mantendrá la temperatura de vacaciones.
featureDescriptions.Auto Mode ⏱ - In this mode, the device e: Modo automático ⏱: en este modo, el dispositivo ejecuta una programación semanal preestablecida de temperatura y hora.
featureDescriptions.The measured CO2 (carbon dioxide) value: El valor medido de CO2 (dióxido de carbono)
featureDescriptions.Turn on/off the strobe (light) during wa: Encender/apagar la luz estroboscópica durante el aviso
featureDescriptions.Duration in seconds of the alarm: Duración en segundos de la alarma
featureDescriptions.Indicates if the device is moving: Indica si el dispositivo se está moviendo
featureDescriptions.Trigger beep for x seconds: Pitido de activación durante x segundos
featureDescriptions.Control status LED when load ON: LED de estado de control cuando la carga está encendida
featureDescriptions.Control status LED when load OFF: Estado LED de control sin carga
featureDescriptions.Control minimum dimmer brightness: Control de la luminosidad mínima del regulador
featureDescriptions.Control backlight dimming behavior: Controlar el comportamiento de atenuación de la luz de fondo
featureDescriptions.Icon shown on device displays: Icono mostrado en las pantallas de los dispositivos
featureDescriptions.Calibrates valve on next wakeup: Calibra la válvula en la siguiente activación
featureDescriptions.Controls Capacitive or Inductive Dimming: Controla el modo de regulación capacitivo o inductivo
featureDescriptions.Is the unit in mounting mode. This is se: ¿Está la unidad en modo de montaje? Esto se establece como `false` si está montada (ya en el radiador) o `true` si no está montada (después de un reinicio de fábrica)
featureDescriptions.Set the unit mounting mode. `false` Go t: Configurar tipo de montaje. `false` Ir a Tipo montaje instalado o `true` Ir a Configuración Tipo montaje
featureDescriptions.Thermostat Orientation. This is importan: Orientación del termostato. Es importante en la medición de la temperatura. `false` Horizontal o `true` Vertical
featureDescriptions.Whether or not the unit needs warm water: Whether or not the unit needs warm water. `false` No Heat Request or `true` Heat Request
featureDescriptions.0=Quarantine, 1=Windows are closed, 2=Ho: 0=Quarantine, 1=Windows are closed, 2=Hold - Windows are maybe about to open, 3=Open window detected, 4=In window open state from external but detected closed locally
featureDescriptions.Set if the window is open or close. This: Set if the window is open or close. This setting will trigger a change in the internal window and heating demand. `false` (windows are closed) or `true` (windows are open)
featureDescriptions.Exercise day of week: 0=Sun...6=Sat, 7=u: Día de ejercicio de la semana: 0=Dom...6=Sáb, 7=no definido
featureDescriptions.Exercise trigger time. Minutes since mid: Hora de inicio planificada en minutos desde medianoche (00:00 HH:MM) (65535=sin definir). Valores entre 0 y 1439
featureDescriptions.Scale factor of setpoint filter timecons: Scale factor of setpoint filter timeconstant ("aggressiveness" of control algorithm) 1= Quick ...  5=Moderate ... 10=Slow
featureDescriptions.Whether or not the thermostat acts as st: Si el termostato actúa o no como termostato independiente o comparte la carga con otros termostatos de la habitación. El gateway debe actualizar load_room_mean si está activado.
featureDescriptions.Load estimate on this radiator: Estimación de la carga de este radiador
featureDescriptions.Blink green LED on motion detection: LED parpadea verde al detectar movimiento
featureDescriptions.Ac louver position of this device: Ac louver position of this device
featureDescriptions.Sound volume of the lock: Volumen del sonido de la cerradura
featureDescriptions.MANUAL MODE ☝ - In this mode, the device: MODO MANUAL ☝ - En este modo, el dispositivo ejecuta el ajuste manual de la temperatura. Cuando la temperatura ajustada es inferior a la "temperatura mínima", la válvula se cierra (cierre forzado). MODO PROGRAMACIÓN ⏱ - En este modo, el dispositivo ejecuta una programación semanal preestablecida de tiempo y temperatura. MODO VACACIONES ⛱ - En este modo, por ejemplo, se programa el modo vacaciones durante 10 días y la temperatura se ajusta a 15 grados centígrados. Después de 10 días, el dispositivo pasará automáticamente al modo de programación. MODO MANUAL TEMPORAL - En este modo, el icono ☝ parpadeará. En ese momento, el dispositivo ajusta la temperatura manualmente y vuelve al modo de programación semanal en el siguiente periodo de tiempo.
featureDescriptions.PROGRAMMING MODE ⏱ - In this mode, the d: PROGRAMMING MODE ⏱ - In this mode, the device executes a preset week programming temperature time and temperature. You can set up to 4 stages of temperature every for WEEKDAY ➀➁➂➃➄,  SATURDAY ➅ and SUNDAY ➆.
featureDescriptions.Select temperature sensor to use: Seleccionar sensor de temperatura a usar
featureDescriptions.Controls behaviour of led/siren on alarm: Controla el comportamiento del LED/sirena en la alarma
featureDescriptions.Alarm zone. Default value 23: Zona de alarma.  Valor por defecto 23
featureDescriptions.Temperature setpoint automatic: Punto de consigna de temperatura automático
featureDescriptions.Open window detection temperature: Temperatura de detección de ventana abierta
featureDescriptions.Open window time in minute: Tiempo de ventana abierta en minutos
featureDescriptions.Specifies the minimum brightness value: Especifica el valor mínimo de brillo
featureDescriptions.Specifies the maximum brightness value: Especifica el valor máximo de brillo
featureDescriptions.Allow the device to change brightness: Permitir que el dispositivo cambie el brillo
featureDescriptions.On/off (works only if device is in \"swi: On/off (sólo funciona si el dispositivo está en modo "switch")
featureDescriptions.switch: allow on/off, auto will use wire: switch: allow on/off, auto will use wired action via C1/C2 on teleruptor with buttons
switch: allow on/off, auto will use wired action via C1/C2 on contactor for example with HC/HP
featureDescriptions.PIR keep time in seconds: Duración mantenimiento estado PIR en segundos
featureDescriptions.Filter is older than 6 months and needs: La antigüedad del filtro es mayor de 6 meses y debe ser sustituido
featureDescriptions.Indicates whether the device detected br: Indica si el dispositivo ha detectado una luz intensa (funciona solo en modo noche)
Prevent changes. `false` = run normally. `true` = prevent from making changes. Must be set to `false` when system_mode = off or `true` for heat
featureDescriptions.Period in minutes for which the setpoint: Period in minutes for which the setpoint hold will be active. 65535 = attribute not used. 0 to 360 to match the remote display
featureDescriptions.Select between direct control of the val: Select between direct control of the valve via the `valve_position` or automatic control of the valve based on the `current_heating_setpoint`. For manual control set the value to 1, for automatic control set the value to 2 (the default). When switched to manual mode the display shows a value from 0 (valve closed) to 100 (valve fully open) and the buttons on the device are disabled.
featureDescriptions.Directly control the radiator valve when: Directly control the radiator valve when `trv_mode` is set to 1. The values range from 0 (valve closed) to 255 (valve fully open)
featureDescriptions.Displayed text on thermostat display (zo: Texto mostrado en la pantalla del termostato (zona). Máximo 14 caracteres
featureDescriptions.Load in W when heating is on (between 0-: Carga en W cuando la calefacción está encendida (entre 0-2000 W). El termostato utiliza el valor como entrada para el cálculo de mean_power.
Dispositivo en modo regulador o termostato.
featureDescriptions.When device is in regulator mode this co: Cuando el dispositivo está en modo regulador, controla el tiempo entre cada conexión de entrada/salida. Cuando el dispositivo está en modo termostato, controla el tiempo entre cada conexión de entrada/salida cuando la temperatura medida está dentro de +-0,5 °C de la temperatura establecida. Elige un tiempo largo para suelos de hormigón (lento) y un tiempo corto para suelos de madera (rápido).
featureDescriptions.Current temperature measured from the fl: Temperatura actual medida desde el sensor de suelo
featureDescriptions.Set max floor temperature (between 20-35: Establecer la temperatura máxima del suelo (entre 20-35 °C) cuando "supervisor_floor" está establecido
featureDescriptions.Reports average power usage last 10 minu: Informa del uso medio de energía en los últimos 10 minutos
featureDescriptions.When frost guard is ON, it is activated: When frost guard is ON, it is activated when the thermostat is switched OFF with the ON/OFF button.At the same time, the display will fade and the text "Frostsikring x °C" appears in the display and remains until the thermostat is switched on again.
Activar o desactivar la configuración nocturna.
featureDescriptions.Time to ring before answer: Tiempo de llamada antes de responder
featureDescriptions.Time to hold before open: Tiempo de espera antes de abrir
featureDescriptions.Time to open before end: Tiempo de apertura antes del final
featureDescriptions.Time after last bell to finish ring: Tiempo después de la última campana para terminar de sonar
featureDescriptions.Enable LEDs feedback: Activar la respuesta de los LEDs
featureDescriptions.Enable ABC (Automatic Baseline Correctio: Habilitar ABC (Corrección automática de línea de base)
featureDescriptions.Current count radioactive pulses per min: Current count radioactive pulses per minute
featureDescriptions.This is applicable if tubes type is set: Esto es aplicable si el tipo de tubo está configurado como otro
featureDescriptions.Indicates whether the device is being te: Indica si el dispositivo está siendo testeado
featureDescriptions.Turn on/off the strobe (light) for Squaw: Turn on/off the strobe (light) for Squawk
featureDescriptions.Pulses per kwh. Default 1000 imp/kWh. Ra: Pulsaciones por kwh. Por defecto 1000 imp/kWh. Rango 0 a 655535
featureDescriptions.Current summation value sent to the disp: Current summation value sent to the display. e.g. 570 = 0,570 kWh
featureDescriptions.Is true if communication problem with me: Es cierto si se experimenta un problema de comunicación con la sonda
featureDescriptions.Indicates reason if any fault: Indica la razón si hay algún fallo
featureDescriptions.Indicates whether the device are in faul: Indica si el dispositivo está en estado de fallo
featureDescriptions.Instantaneous measured electrical curren: Instantaneous measured electrical current on phase B
featureDescriptions.Measured electrical potential value on p: Measured electrical potential value on phase B
featureDescriptions.Instantaneous measured electrical curren: Instantaneous measured electrical current on phase C
featureDescriptions.Measured electrical potential value on p: Measured electrical potential value on phase C
featureDescriptions.Allow Master PIN Unlock: Permitir el desbloqueo por PIN maestro
featureDescriptions.Lock-Mode of the Lock: Modo de bloqueo de la cerradura
featureDescriptions.Service Mode of the Lock: Modo de servicio de la cerradura
featureDescriptions.Absolute min temperature allowed on the: Temperatura mínima absoluta permitida en el dispositivo
featureDescriptions.Absolute max temperature allowed on the: Temperatura máxima absoluta permitida en el dispositivo
featureDescriptions.Min temperature limit set on the device: Límite mínimo de temperatura establecido en el dispositivo
featureDescriptions.Max temperature limit set on the device: Límite máximo de temperatura establecido en el dispositivo
featureDescriptions.Type of user, unrestricted: owner (defau: Type of user, unrestricted: owner (default), (year|week)_day_schedule: user has ability to open lock based on specific time period, master: user has ability to both program and operate the door lock, non_access: user is recognized by the lock but does not have the ability to open the lock
featureDescriptions.After turn on, the indicator light turns: After turn on, the indicator light turns on while switch is off, and vice versa
The current state of the motor.
featureDescriptions.Gas concentration value at which an alar: Gas concentration value at which an alarm is triggered ("10%LEL" is more sensitive than "15%LEL")
featureDescriptions.Starts the self-test process (checking t: Starts the self-test process (checking the indicator light and buzzer work properly)
featureDescriptions.\"Preparation\" or \"work\" (measurement: "Preparation" or "work" (measurement of the gas concentration value and triggering of an alarm are only performed in the "work" state)
featureDescriptions.Number of power outages (since last pair: Number of power outages (since last pairing)
featureDescriptions.Monitoring mode with or without consider: Monitoring mode with or without considering right and left sides
featureDescriptions.The distance at which the sensor detects: The distance at which the sensor detects approaching
featureDescriptions.Switch between rgbw mode or dual color t: Switch between rgbw mode or dual color temperature mode
featureDescriptions.presets for sensitivity for presence and: presets for sensitivity for presence and movement
featureDescriptions.When Anti-Freezing function is activated: When Anti-Freezing function is activated, the temperature in the house is kept at 8 °C, the device display "AF".press the pair button to cancel.
featureDescriptions.Battery life can be prolonged by switchi: La vida de la batería puede prolongarse desconectando la calefacción. Para ello, la válvula se cierra por completo. Para activar la parada de la calefacción, el dispositivo muestra "HS", pulse el botón de emparejar para cancelar.
featureDescriptions.Mode of this device, in the `heat` mode: Mode of this device, in the `heat` mode the TS0601 will remain continuously heating, i.e. it does not regulate to the desired temperature. If you want TRV to properly regulate the temperature you need to use mode `auto` instead setting the desired temperature.
featureDescriptions.Indicates whether the device detected no: Indicates whether the device detected noise
featureDescriptions.Valve state if open or closed: Valve state if open or closed
featureDescriptions.Pincode to set, set pincode(4 digit) to: Pincode to set, set pincode(4 digit) to null to clear
featureDescriptions.Time in seconds after which occupancy is: Time in seconds after which occupancy is cleared after detecting it
featureDescriptions.Sets dimming mode to autodetect or fixed: Sets dimming mode to autodetect or fixed RC/RL/RL_LED mode (max load is reduced in RL_LED)
featureDescriptions.Controls how programming affects the the: Controls how programming affects the thermostat. Possible values: setpoint (only use specified setpoint), schedule (follow programmed setpoint schedule). Changing this value does not clear programmed schedules.
featureDescriptions.Not clear how this affects operation. Ho: No está claro cómo afecta esto al funcionamiento. Sin embargo, parece que el dispositivo no ejecuta ninguna función del motor si se ajusta a falso. Esto puede ser un medio para conservar la batería durante los períodos en los que el sistema de calefacción no está alimentado (por ejemplo, durante el verano). `false` No hay calefacción disponible o `true` Calefacción disponible
featureDescriptions.If `radiator_covered` is `true`: Set at: If `radiator_covered` is `true`: Set at maximum 30 minutes interval but not more often than every 5 minutes and 0.1 degrees difference. Resets every 35 minutes to standard. If `radiator_covered` is `false`: Set at maximum 3 hours interval but not more often than every 30 minutes and 0.1 degrees difference. Resets every 3 hours to standard. Value 21C = 2100 (-8000=undefined).
featureDescriptions.Set if the TRV should solely rely on ext: Set if the TRV should solely rely on external_measured_room_sensor or operate in offset mode. `false` = Auto Offset Mode or `true` = Room Sensor Mode
featureDescriptions.Whether or not the window open feature i: Whether or not the window open feature is enabled
featureDescriptions.Mean radiator load for room calculated b: Mean radiator load for room calculated by gateway for load balancing purposes (-8000=undefined)
featureDescriptions.The delta between local_temperature and: The delta between local_temperature and current_heating_setpoint to trigger Heat
featureDescriptions.Current point of the active load curve d: Current point of the active load curve drawn
featureDescriptions.Previous point of the active load curve: Previous point of the active load curve drawn
featureDescriptions.Point n of the withdrawn active load cur: Point n of the withdrawn active load curve
featureDescriptions.Point n-1 of the withdrawn active load c: Point n-1 of the withdrawn active load curve
featureDescriptions.Profile of the next supplier calendar da: Profile of the next supplier calendar day
featureDescriptions.Profile of the next check-in day: Profile of the next check-in day
featureDescriptions.Works only when the pilot wire is deacti: Works only when the pilot wire is deactivated
featureDescriptions.Indicates if the card is inserted (= tru: Indicates if the card is inserted (= true) or not (= false)
Prevent changes. `false` = run normally. `true` = prevent from making changes.
featureDescriptions.Enable or disable the blue backlight LED: Enable or disable the blue backlight LED
featureDescriptions.Source of the triggered action on the lo: Source of the triggered action on the lock
featureDescriptions.ID of user that triggered the action on: ID of user that triggered the action on the lock
featureDescriptions.Whether the motor is moving or not: Whether the motor is moving or not
featureDescriptions.Value of smoke concentration in dB/m: Value of smoke concentration in dB/m
featureDescriptions.When this option is enabled then in the: When this option is enabled then in the normal monitoring state, the green indicator light flashes every 60 seconds
featureDescriptions.Different sensitivities means different: Different sensitivities means different static human body recognition rate and response speed of occupied
featureDescriptions.Reset the status of no presence: Reset the status of no presence
featureDescriptions.PIR sensor sensitivity (refresh and upda: PIR sensor sensitivity (refresh and update only while active)
featureDescriptions.PIR keep time in seconds (refresh and up: PIR keep time in seconds (refresh and update only while active)
featureDescriptions.Self_test, possible resuts: checking, ch: Self_test, possible resuts: checking, check_success, check_failure, others, comm_fault, radar_fault.
featureDescriptions.Indicates if the garage door contact is: Indicates if the garage door contact is closed (= true) or open (= false)
featureDescriptions.Group where the action was triggered on: Group where the action was triggered on
featureDescriptions.Time in seconds after which noise is cle: Time in seconds after which noise is cleared after detecting it (default: 60)
featureDescriptions.Time in seconds after which occupancy is: Time in seconds after which occupancy is cleared after detecting it (default: 60)
featureDescriptions.Self-heating compensation. The compensat: Self-heating compensation. The compensation value is subtracted from the measured temperature
featureDescriptions.If the sensor is triggered by the slight: If the sensor is triggered by the slightest movement, reduce the sensitivity, otherwise increase it (default: 50)
featureDescriptions.The minimum noise level at which the det: The minimum noise level at which the detector will work (default: 50)
Automatic calibration of the CO2 sensor. If ON, the CO2 sensor will automatically calibrate every 7 days.
featureDescriptions.Ventilate the room for 20 minutes, turn: Ventilate the room for 20 minutes, turn on manual calibration, and turn it off after one second. After about 5 minutes the CO2 sensor will show 400ppm. Calibration completed
featureDescriptions.Turn on when working in conditions of hi: Turn on when working in conditions of high humidity (more than 70 %, RH) or condensation, if the sensor shows 0 or 100 %.
featureDescriptions.Instantaneous measured power on phase A: Instantaneous measured power on phase A
featureDescriptions.Instantaneous measured power on phase B: Instantaneous measured power on phase B
featureDescriptions.Instantaneous measured power on phase C: Instantaneous measured power on phase C
featureDescriptions.Sum of consumed energy on phase A: Sum of consumed energy on phase A
featureDescriptions.Sum of consumed energy on phase B: Sum of consumed energy on phase B
featureDescriptions.Sum of consumed energy on phase C: Sum of consumed energy on phase C
featureDescriptions.Measured electrical potential value on p: Measured electrical potential value on phase A
featureDescriptions.Measured electrical potential value betw: Measured electrical potential value between phase A and B
Measured electrical potential value between phase B and C
Measured electrical potential value between phase C and A
featureDescriptions.Instantaneous measured electrical curren: Instantaneous measured electrical current on phase A
featureDescriptions.Specific for pre-heat running in Zigbee: Specific for pre-heat running in Zigbee Weekly Schedule mode
featureDescriptions.Status of adaptation run: None (before f: Status of adaptation run: None (before first run), In Progress, Valve Characteristic Found, Valve Characteristic Lost
featureDescriptions.Automatic adaptation run enabled (the on: Automatic adaptation run enabled (the one during the night)
featureDescriptions.Adaptation run control: Initiate Adaptat: Adaptation run control: Initiate Adaptation Run or Cancel Adaptation Run
featureDescriptions.Regulation SetPoint Offset in range -2.5: Regulation SetPoint Offset in range -2.5°C to 2.5°C in steps of 0.1°C. Value 2.5°C = 25.
featureDescriptions.OLED brightness when operating the butto: OLED brightness when operating the buttons.  Default: Medium.
featureDescriptions.Key beep volume and vibration level. De: Key beep volume and vibration level.  Default: Low.
featureDescriptions.Type of the external floor sensor. Defa: Type of the external floor sensor.  Default: NTC 10K/25.
featureDescriptions.The sensor used for heat control. Defau: The sensor used for heat control.  Default: Room Sensor.
featureDescriptions.The mode after a power reset. Default:: The mode after a power reset.  Default: Previous Mode.
featureDescriptions.The tempearatue calibration for the exer: The tempearatue calibration for the exernal floor sensor, between -3 and 3 in 0.1°C.  Default: 0.
featureDescriptions.The duration of Dry Mode, between 5 and: The duration of Dry Mode, between 5 and 100 minutes.  Default: 5.
The mode after Dry Mode.  Default: Auto.
featureDescriptions.The temperature on the display. Default: The temperature on the display.  Default: Room Temperature.
featureDescriptions.The threshold to detect window open, bet: The threshold to detect window open, between 1.5 and 4 in 0.5 °C.  Default: 0 (disabled).
featureDescriptions.Hysteresis setting, between 0.5 and 2 in: Hysteresis setting, between 0.5 and 2 in 0.1 °C.  Default: 0.5.
featureDescriptions.Room temperature alarm threshold, betwee: Room temperature alarm threshold, between 20 and 60 in °C.  0 means disabled.  Default: 45.
featureDescriptions.Animation Effect to use for the LEDs: Animation Effect to use for the LEDs
featureDescriptions.Calculated by using a hue color circle(v: Calculated by using a hue color circle(value/255*360) If color = 255 display white
featureDescriptions.1-60 is in seconds calculated 61-120 is: 1-60 is in seconds calculated 61-120 is in minutes calculated by(value-60) Example a value of 65 would be 65-60 = 5 minutes - 120-254 Is in hours calculated by(value-120) Example a value of 132 would be 132-120 would be 12 hours. - 255 Indefinitely
featureDescriptions.Animation Effect to use for the LED: Animation Effect to use for the LED
featureDescriptions.1-60 is in seconds calculated 61-120 is: 1-60 is in seconds calculated 61-120 is in minutes calculated by(value-60) Example a value of 65 would be 65-60 = 5 minutes - 120-254 Is in hours calculated by(value-120)  Example a value of 132 would be 132-120 would be 12 hours. - 255 Indefinitely
featureDescriptions.This changes the speed that the light di: This changes the speed that the light dims up when controlled from the hub. A setting of 0 turns the light immediately on. Increasing the value slows down the transition speed. Every number represents 100ms. Default = 25 (2.5s)

This changes the speed that the light dims up when controlled at the switch. A setting of 0 turns the light immediately on. Increasing the value slows down the transition speed. Every number represents 100ms. Default = 127 - Keep in sync with dimmingSpeedUpRemote setting.
featureDescriptions.This changes the speed that the light tu: This changes the speed that the light turns on when controlled from the hub. A setting of 0 turns the light immediately on. Increasing the value slows down the transition speed. Every number represents 100ms. Default = 127 - Keep in sync with dimmingSpeedUpRemote setting.

This changes the speed that the light turns on when controlled at the switch. A setting of 0 turns the light immediately on. Increasing the value slows down the transition speed. Every number represents 100ms. Default = 127 - Keep in sync with dimmingSpeedUpRemote setting.
featureDescriptions.This changes the speed that the light di: This changes the speed that the light dims down when controlled from the hub. A setting of 0 turns the light immediately off. Increasing the value slows down the transition speed. Every number represents 100ms. Default = 127 - Keep in sync with dimmingSpeedUpRemote setting.

This changes the speed that the light dims down when controlled at the switch. A setting of 0 turns the light immediately off. Increasing the value slows down the transition speed. Every number represents 100ms. Default = 127 - Keep in sync with dimmingSpeedUpLocal setting.
featureDescriptions.This changes the speed that the light tu: This changes the speed that the light turns off when controlled from the hub. A setting of 'instant' turns the light immediately off. Increasing the value slows down the transition speed. Every number represents 100ms. Default = 127 - Keep in sync with rampRateOffToOnRemote setting.

This changes the speed that the light turns off when controlled at the switch. A setting of 'instant' turns the light immediately off. Increasing the value slows down the transition speed. Every number represents 100ms. Default = 127 - Keep in sync with rampRateOffToOnLocal setting.
featureDescriptions.The minimum level that the dimmer allows: The minimum level that the dimmer allows the bulb to be dimmed to. Useful when the user has an LED bulb that does not turn on or flickers at a lower level.
featureDescriptions.The maximum level that the dimmer allows: The maximum level that the dimmer allows the bulb to be dimmed to.Useful when the user has an LED bulb that reaches its maximum level before the dimmer value of 99 or when the user wants to limit the maximum brightness.
featureDescriptions.Inverts the orientation of the switch. U: Inverts the orientation of the switch. Useful when the switch is installed upside down. Essentially up becomes down and down becomes up.
featureDescriptions.Automatically turns the switch off after: Automatically turns the switch off after this many seconds. When the switch is turned on a timer is started. When the timer expires, the switch is turned off. 0 = Auto off is disabled.
featureDescriptions.Default level for the dimmer when it is: Default level for the dimmer when it is turned on at the switch. A setting of 0 means that the switch will return to the level that it was on before it was turned off.
Default level for the dimmer when it is turned on from the hub. A setting of 0 means that the switch will return to the level that it was on before it was turned off.
featureDescriptions.The state the switch should return to wh: The state the switch should return to when power is restored after power failure. 0 = off, 1-100 = level, 101 = previous.
featureDescriptions.Shows the level that the load is at for: Shows the level that the load is at for x number of seconds after the load is adjusted and then returns to the Default LED state. 0 = Stay Off, 1-10 = seconds, 11 = Stay On.
featureDescriptions.Power level change that will result in a: Power level change that will result in a new power report being sent. The value is a percentage of the previous report.0 = disabled, 1-32767 = 0.1W-3276.7W.
featureDescriptions.Time period between consecutive power &: Time period between consecutive power & energy reports being sent (in seconds). The timer is reset after each report is sent.
featureDescriptions.Energy reports Energy level change which: Energy reports Energy level change which will result in sending a new energy report.0 = disabled, 1-32767 = 0.01kWh-327.67kWh. Default setting: 10 (0.1 kWh)
Set the power type for the device.
featureDescriptions.This will set the button press delay. 0: This will set the button press delay. 0 = no delay (Disables Button Press Events), 1 = 100ms, 2 = 200ms, 3 = 300ms, etc. up to 900ms. Default = 500ms.
featureDescriptions.For use with Smart Bulbs that need const: For use with Smart Bulbs that need constant power and are controlled via commands rather than power.
featureDescriptions.Set the color of the LED Indicator when: Set the color of the LED Indicator when the load is on.
Set the color of the LED Indicator when the load is off.
featureDescriptions.Set the intensity of the LED Indicator w: Set the intensity of the LED Indicator when the load is on.
Set the intensity of the LED Indicator when the load is off.
Ability to control switch from the wall.
Ability to control switch from the hub.
featureDescriptions.Use device as a Dimmer or an On/Off swit: Use device as a Dimmer or an On/Off switch.
featureDescriptions.When the device is in On/Off mode, use f: When the device is in On/Off mode, use full LED bar or just one LED.
featureDescriptions.Display progress on LED bar during firmw: Display progress on LED bar during firmware update.
featureDescriptions.0-254:This is the color of the LED strip: 0-254:This is the color of the LED strip in a hex representation. 255:Synchronization with default all LED strip color parameter.
featureDescriptions.Intesity of LED strip when on. 101 = Syn: Intesity of LED strip when on. 101 = Syncronized with default all LED strip intensity parameter.
featureDescriptions.Intesity of LED strip when off. 101 = Sy: Intesity of LED strip when off. 101 = Syncronized with default all LED strip intensity parameter.
Result of a double tap on the up button.
featureDescriptions.Current temperature measured on the exte: Current temperature measured on the external sensor (floor)
featureDescriptions.The difference between the temperature a: The difference between the temperature at which the thermostat switches off, and the temperature at which it switches on again.
featureDescriptions.Units to show on the display: Units to show on the display
featureDescriptions.The buzzer can be muted and alarmed manu: The buzzer can be muted and alarmed manually. During a smoke alarm, the buzzer can be manually muted for 80 seconds ("mute") and unmuted ("alarm"). The buzzer cannot be pre-muted, as this function only works during a smoke alarm. During the absence of a smoke alarm, the buzzer can be manually alarmed ("alarm") and disalarmed ("mute")
featureDescriptions.When this option is enabled and a smoke: When this option is enabled and a smoke alarm has occurred, then "linkage_alarm_state"=true, and when the smoke alarm has ended or the buzzer has been manually muted, then "linkage_alarm_state"=false
featureDescriptions.The buzzer can be muted and alarmed manu: The buzzer can be muted and alarmed manually. During a gas alarm, the buzzer can be manually muted for 10 minutes ("mute"), but cannot be unmuted manually before this timeout expires. The buzzer cannot be pre-muted, as this function only works during a gas alarm. During the absence of a gas alarm, the buzzer can be manually alarmed ("alarm") and disalarmed ("mute")
featureDescriptions.When this option is enabled and a gas al: When this option is enabled and a gas alarm has occurred, then "linkage_alarm_state"=true, and when the gas alarm has ended or the buzzer has been manually muted, then "linkage_alarm_state"=false
featureDescriptions.. Press pairing button right before chan: . Press pairing button right before changing this otherwise it will fail.
featureDescriptions.Time interval for detecting actions. Pre: Time interval for detecting actions. Press pairing button right before changing this otherwise it will fail.
featureDescriptions.When this option is enabled then blue LE: When this option is enabled then blue LED will blink once when motion is detected. Press pairing button right before changing this otherwise it will fail.
featureDescriptions.When Vacation Mode is active the schedul: When Vacation Mode is active the schedule is disabled and unoccupied_heating_setpoint is used.
featureDescriptions.Shows the presence duration in minutes: Shows the presence duration in minutes
featureDescriptions.Shows the duration of the absence in min: Shows the duration of the absence in minutes
featureDescriptions.Turns the onboard LED on or off: Turns the onboard LED on or off
featureDescriptions.Turn on to learn new IR code: Turn on to learn new IR code
featureDescriptions.The IR code learned by device: The IR code learned by device
featureDescriptions.The IR code to send by device: The IR code to send by device
featureDescriptions.There are 8 periods in the schedule in t: There are 8 periods in the schedule in total. 6 for workdays and 2 for holidays. It should be set in the following format for each of the periods: `hours:minutes/temperature`. All periods should be set at once and delimited by the space symbol. For example: `06:00/20.5 08:00/15 11:30/15 13:30/15 17:00/22 22:00/15 06:00/20 22:00/15`. The thermostat doesn't report the schedule by itself even if you change it manually from device
featureDescriptions.Switches beep sound when interacting wit: Switches beep sound when interacting with thermostat
featureDescriptions.Resets all settings to default. Doesn't: Resets all settings to default. Doesn't unpair device.
featureDescriptions.Indicator light status: LOW: Off | MEDIU: Indicator light status: LOW: Off | MEDIUM: On| HIGH: Inverted
featureDescriptions.The threshold to detect window open, bet: The threshold to detect window open, between 0.0 and 8.0 in 0.5 °C.  Default: 0 (disabled).
featureDescriptions.Operation mode: \"auto\" - toggle by S/W: Operation mode: "auto" - toggle by S/W, "push" - for momentary S/W, "latch" - sync S/W
featureDescriptions.Enable RF pairing mode each button l1, l: Enable RF pairing mode each button l1, l2, l3
featureDescriptions.Indicates whether \"IN\" Sensor of the d: Indicates whether "IN" Sensor of the device detected occupancy
featureDescriptions.Indicates whether \"OUT\" Sensor of the: Indicates whether "OUT" Sensor of the device detected occupancy
featureDescriptions.Indicates whether \"IN or OUT\" Sensor o: Indicates whether "IN or OUT" Sensor of the device detected occupancy
featureDescriptions.Indicates whether \"IN and OUT\" Sensor: Indicates whether "IN and OUT" Sensor of the device detected occupancy
featureDescriptions.Counting Freeze ON/OFF, not reporting pe: Counting Freeze ON/OFF, not reporting people value when is ON
featureDescriptions.Fast process enable/disable when people: Fast process enable/disable when people 0 to 1. default : enable
Fast process enable/disable when people 1 to 0. default : enable
featureDescriptions.Format 08:00 / 20:00 / 15 / 60 / MoTuWeT: Format 08:00 / 20:00 / 15 / 60 / MoTuWeThFrSaSu / 1 (08:00 = start time 20:00 = end time 15 = irrigation duration in minutes 60 = pause duration in minutes MoTu..= active weekdays 1 = deactivate timer with 0)
featureDescriptions.Format 08:00 / 15 / MoTuWeThFrSaSu / 1 (: Format 08:00 / 15 / MoTuWeThFrSaSu / 1 (08:00 = start time 15 = duration in minutes MoTu..= active weekdays 1 = deactivate timer with 0)
featureDescriptions.Remaning watering time (for auto shutdow: Remaning watering time (for auto shutdown). Updates every minute, and every 10s in the last minute.
Set valve to % with auto shutdown.
featureDescriptions.Directly control the radiator valve. The: Directly control the radiator valve. The values range from 0 (valve closed) to 100 (valve fully open)
featureDescriptions.How hard the motor pushes the valve. The: How hard the motor pushes the valve. The closer to the boiler, the higher the force needed
featureDescriptions.Transmits with higher power when range i: Transmits with higher power when range is not sufficient
featureDescriptions.Indicates if the alarm is triggered on t: Indicates if the alarm is triggered on the voltage drop below the limit, allows to reset alarms
Indicates if the alarm is triggered on the voltage rise above the limit, allows to reset alarms
Indicates if the alarm is triggered on the active power rise above the limit, allows to reset alarms
featureDescriptions.Indicates if the alarm is triggered when: Indicates if the alarm is triggered when the consumption energy limit is reached, allows to reset alarms
featureDescriptions.Minimum allowable voltage limit for alar: Minimum allowable voltage limit for alarms.
featureDescriptions.Maximum allowable voltage limit for alar: Maximum allowable voltage limit for alarms.
featureDescriptions.Maximum allowable power limit for alarms: Maximum allowable power limit for alarms.
featureDescriptions.Limit of electric energy consumption in: Limit of electric energy consumption in kW*h. 0 value represents no limit
featureDescriptions.Specifies the initialisation light level: Specifies the initialisation light level. Can not be set lower than "ballast_minimum_level"
featureDescriptions.Enables the LED when the light is turned:
Enables the LED when the light is turned off, allowing to 
                see the switch in the dark
Enables the LED when the light is turned on
featureDescriptions.Controls the behavior when the device is:
Controls the behavior when the device is powered on. Works only when the pilot wire is
                deactivated
featureDescriptions.Enables the LED when the power socket is:
Enables the LED when the power socket is turned off,
                allowing to see it in the dark
featureDescriptions.Enables the LED when the device is turne: Enables the LED when the device is turned on
featureDescriptions.Only shows the transmitted color in X7Y-: Only shows the transmitted color in X7Y-Mode. Noch changes possible.
featureDescriptions.color temperature value. Fixed values fo: color temperature value. Fixed values for each key press: 145, 175, 222, 304, 480 mired
featureDescriptions.Shows the zigbee2mqtt group bound to the: Shows the zigbee2mqtt group bound to the active data point EP(1-4).
featureDescriptions.The number of seconds to wait after unlo: The number of seconds to wait after unlocking a lock before it automatically locks again. 0=disabled
featureDescriptions.Irrigation Target, duration in minutes o: Irrigation Target, duration in minutes or capacity in Litres (depending on mode)
featureDescriptions.Number of cycle irrigation times, set to: Number of cycle irrigation times, set to 0 for single cycle
featureDescriptions.Adjust Report Delay. Setting the time in: Adjust Report Delay. Setting the time in minutes, by default 5 minutes
featureDescriptions.Setting the altitude above sea level (fo: Setting the altitude above sea level (for high accuracy of the CO2 sensor)
featureDescriptions.Start FRC (Perform Forced Recalibration: Start FRC (Perform Forced Recalibration of the CO2 Sensor)
featureDescriptions.Start Manual FRC (Perform Forced Recalib: Start Manual FRC (Perform Forced Recalibration of the CO2 Sensor)
featureDescriptions.Enable or Disable Auto Brightness of the: Enable or Disable Auto Brightness of the Display
featureDescriptions.The period of plotting the CO2 level(OFF: The period of plotting the CO2 level(OFF - 1H | ON - 24H)
featureDescriptions.Adjust Report Delay, by default 60 minut: Ajustar el retraso del informe, por defecto 60 minutos
featureDescriptions.Adjust Report Delay. Setting the time in: Ajuste el retraso del informe. Configuración del tiempo en minutos, por defecto 15 minutos
featureDescriptions.The device sends commands with this grou: El dispositivo envía comandos con este ID de grupo. Pon dispositivos en este grupo para controlarlos.
featureDescriptions.Indicates whether there is an active wat: Indica si hay una fuga de agua activa
featureDescriptions.Physical input on the device enabled/dis: Physical input on the device enabled/disabled
featureDescriptions.Load in W when heating is on (between 0-: Load in W when heating is on (between 0-3600 W). The thermostat uses the value as input to the mean_power calculation.
featureDescriptions.Displayed text on thermostat display (zo: Displayed text on thermostat display (zone). Max 19 characters
featureDescriptions.Setpoint in %, use only when the thermos: Setpoint in %, use only when the thermostat is in regulator mode.
featureDescriptions.Current temperature measured from the ai: Current temperature measured from the air sensor

featureNames.current_heating_setpoint: Punto de ajuste de calor actual
featureNames.on_off_transition_time: Tiempo de transición entre encendido y apagado
featureNames.action_rotation_angle_speed: Velocidad de ángulo de rotación acción
featureNames.action_rotation_percent_speed: Porcentaje de velocidad de rotación acción
featureNames.occupancy_timeout: Tiempo de espera de la ocupación
featureNames.rampRateOffToOnRemote: Ramp Rate Off To On Remote
featureNames.rampRateOffToOnLocal: Ramp Rate Off To On Local
featureNames.rampRateOnToOffRemote: Ramp Rate On To Off Remote
featureNames.rampRateOnToOffLocal: Ramp Rate On To Off Local

groups.new_group_id_placeholder: Especifica el id de grupo si es necesario

map.help_coordinator_link_description: Las líneas continuas son el enlace al coordinador
map.help_lqi_description: La calidad del enlace está entre 0 - 255 (cuanto más alto mejor), valores con / representan múltiples tipos de enlaces
map.help_router_links_description: Las líneas discontinuas son el enlace con los routers
map.loading: Dependiendo del tamaño de tu red esto puede tardar entre 10 segundos y 2 minutos.

ota.empty_ota_message: No tienes ningún dispositivo compatible con OTA

donation_text: Hola %username%, aquí puedes agradecer nuestro duro trabajo.
No dudes en decir algo bueno también ;)

zigbee.block_join: Evitar que se una de nuevo
zigbee.update_Home_assistant_entity_id: Actualizar el ID de entidad de Home Assistant

settingsSchemaDescriptions.Allow new devices to join (re-applied at: Permitir que se unan nuevos dispositivos (se vuelve a aplicar al reiniciar)
You can define external converters to e.g. add support for a DiY device
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Time after which an active device will b: Time after which an active device will be marked as offline in minutes
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Options for passive devices (mostly batt: Opciones para dispositivos pasivos (principalmente dispositivos a batería)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Time after which an passive device will: Time after which an passive device will be marked as offline in minutes
settingsSchemaDescriptions.MQTT base topic for Zigbee2MQTT MQTT mes: Tema base MQTT para mensajes MQTT Zigbee2MQTT
settingsSchemaDescriptions.MQTT server URL (use mqtts:// for SSL/TL: MQTT server URL (use mqtts:// for SSL/TLS connection)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Absolute path to SSL/TLS certificate of: Absolute path to SSL/TLS certificate of CA used to sign server and client certificates
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Absolute path to SSL/TLS key for client-: Absolute path to SSL/TLS key for client-authentication
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Absolute path to SSL/TLS certificate for: Absolute path to SSL/TLS certificate for client-authentication
settingsSchemaDescriptions.MQTT server authentication user: Usuario de autenticación del servidor MQTT
settingsSchemaDescriptions.MQTT server authentication password: Contraseña de autenticación del servidor MQTT
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Disable self-signed SSL certificate: Desactiva el certificado SSL auto firmado
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Include device information to mqtt messa: Incluir información del dispositivo en los mensajes mqtt
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Disable retain for all send messages. ON: Disable retain for all send messages. ONLY enable if you MQTT broker doesn't support retained message (e.g. AWS IoT core, Azure IoT Hub, Google Cloud IoT core, IBM Watson IoT Platform). Enabling will break the Home Assistant integration
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Location of the adapter. To autodetect t: Location of the adapter. To autodetect the port, set null
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Disable LED of the adapter if supported: Disable LED of the adapter if supported
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Adapter type, not needed unless you are: Adapter type, not needed unless you are experiencing problems
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Block devices from the network (by ieeeA: Block devices from the network (by ieeeAddr)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Allow only certain devices to join the n: Permitir que sólo ciertos dispositivos se unan a la red (por ieeeAddr). Tenga en cuenta que todos los dispositivos que no estén en la lista de acceso serán eliminados de la red.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Transmit power of adapter, only availabl: Transmit power of adapter, only available for Z-Stack (CC253*/CC2652/CC1352) adapters, CC2652 = 5dbm, CC1352 max is = 20dbm (5dbm default)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Examples when 'state' of a device is pub: Examples when 'state' of a device is published json: topic: 'zigbee2mqtt/my_bulb' payload '{"state": "ON"}' attribute: topic 'zigbee2mqtt/my_bulb/state' payload 'ON' attribute_and_json: both json and attribute (see above)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.ZigBee pan ID, changing requires repairi: ZigBee pan ID, changing requires repairing all devices!
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Zigbee extended pan ID, changing require: Zigbee extended pan ID, changing requires repairing all devices!
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Zigbee channel, changing requires repair: Zigbee channel, changing requires repairing all devices! (Note: use a ZLL channel: 11, 15, 20, or 25 to avoid Problems)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.MQTT message payload will contain all at: La carga del mensaje MQTT contendrá todos los atributos, no sólo los modificados. Tiene que ser true cuando se integra a través de Home Assistant
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Persist cached state, only used when cac: Persist cached state, only used when cache_state: true
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Send cached state on startup, only used: Send cached state on startup, only used when cache_state: true
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Create symlink to current logs in the lo: Create symlink to current logs in the log directory
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Log file name, can also contain timestam: Log file name, can also contain timestamp
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Baud rate speed for serial port, this ca: Baud rate speed for serial port, this can be anything firmware support but default is 115200 for Z-Stack and EZSP, 38400 for Deconz, however note that some EZSP firmware need 57600
settingsSchemaDescriptions.RTS / CTS Hardware Flow Control for seri: RTS / CTS Hardware Flow Control for serial port
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Network encryption key, changing require: Network encryption key, changing requires repairing all devices!
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Add a last_seen attribute to MQTT messag: Add a last_seen attribute to MQTT messages, contains date/time of last Zigbee message
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Add an elapsed attribute to MQTT message: Añade un atributo de tiempo transcurrido a los mensajes MQTT, contiene milisegundos desde el mensaje anterior
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Home Assistant legacy entity attributes,: Home Assistant legacy entity attributes, when enabled Zigbee2MQTT will add state attributes to each entity, additional to the separate entities and devices it already creates
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Adapter concurrency (e.g. 2 for CC2531 o: Adapter concurrency (e.g. 2 for CC2531 or 16 for CC26X2R1) (default: null, uses recommended value)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Use IKEA TRADFRI OTA test server, see OT: Use IKEA TRADFRI OTA test server, see OTA updates documentation
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Home Assistant legacy triggers, when ena: Home Assistant legacy triggers, when enabled Zigbee2mqt will send an empty 'action' or 'click' after one has been send. A 'sensor_action' and 'sensor_click' will be discoverd
settingsSchemaDescriptions.The host running syslogd, defaults to lo: The host running syslogd, defaults to localhost.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.The port on the host that syslog is runn: The port on the host that syslog is running on, defaults to syslogd's default port.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.The network protocol to log over (e.g. t: The network protocol to log over (e.g. tcp4, udp4, tls4, unix, unix-connect, etc).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.The path to the syslog dgram socket (i.e: The path to the syslog dgram socket (i.e. /dev/log or /var/run/syslog for OS X).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.PID of the process that log messages are: PID of the process that log messages are coming from (Default process.pid).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Host to indicate that log messages are c: Host to indicate that log messages are coming from (Default: localhost).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.The type of the syslog protocol to use (: The type of the syslog protocol to use (Default: BSD, also valid: 5424).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.The name of the application (Default: Zi: El nombre de la aplicación (por defecto: Zigbee2MQTT).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.The end of line character to be added to: The end of line character to be added to the end of the message (Default: Message without modifications).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Your device may request a check for a ne: Tu dispositivo puede solicitar una comprobación para una actualización de firmware. Este valor determina como de frecuentemente pueden ser contactados los servidores de terceros para buscar actualizaciones de firmware. El valor se establece en minutos, y el valor por defecto es 1 día.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Zigbee devices may request a firmware up: Zigbee devices may request a firmware update, and do so frequently, causing Zigbee2MQTT to reach out to third party servers. If you disable these device initiated checks, you can still initiate a firmware update check manually.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Used in the MQTT topic of a device. By d: Se utiliza en el asunto MQTT de un dispositivo. Por defecto es el ID del dispositivo
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Retain MQTT messages of this device: Conservar los mensajes MQTT de este dispositivo
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Sets the MQTT Message Expiry in seconds,: Establece la caducidad de los mensajes MQTT en segundos, asegúrese de establecer mqtt.version a 5
settingsSchemaDescriptions.QoS level for MQTT messages of this devi: Nivel de QoS para los mensajes MQTT de este dispositivo
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Protects unique payload values of specif: Protects unique payload values of specified payload properties from overriding within debounce time
settingsSchemaDescriptions.The user-defined device icon for the fro: El icono del dispositivo definido por el usuario para el frontend. Puede ser un enlace a una imagen (no una ruta a un archivo) o una URL de datos codificados en base64 como: image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB3aW....R0aD
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Location of override OTA index file: Location of override OTA index file
settingsSchemaDescriptions.URL on which the frontend can be reached: URL on which the frontend can be reached, currently only used for the Home Assistant device configuration page
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Output location of the log, leave empty: Output location of the log, leave empty to suppress logging
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Home Assistant legacy triggers, when ena: Home Assistant legacy triggers, when enabled Zigbee2mqt will send an empty 'action' or 'click' after one has been send. A 'sensor_action' and 'sensor_click' will be discovered
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Payload to be used for device availabilt: Payload to be used for device availabilty and bridge/state topics. true = text, false = JSON
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Name of the device in Home Assistant: Name of the device in Home Assistant
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Control when to publish state OFF for a: Control when to publish state OFF for a group. 'all_members_off': only publish state OFF when all group memebers are in state OFF, 'last_member_state': publish state OFF whenever one of its members changes to OFF
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Filter attributes with regex from publis: Filter attributes with regex from published payload.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Filter attributes with regex from being: Filter attributes with regex from being added to the cache, this prevents the attribute from being in the published payload when the value didn't change.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Filter attributes with regex from optimi: Filter attributes with regex from optimistic publish payload when calling /set. (This has no effect if optimistic is set to false).

settingsSchemaTitles.IKEA TRADFRI OTA use test url: IKEA TRADFRI OTA use test url
settingsSchemaTitles.Disable automatic update check: Deshabilitar la comprobación automática de actualizaciones
settingsSchemaTitles.Options that are applied to all devices: Options that are applied to all devices
settingsSchemaTitles.IKEA TRADFRI OTA use test url (deprecate: IKEA TRADFRI OTA use test url (deprecated)
